titles.title: Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to correct the enrollment of H.R. 1429.
Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to correct the enrollment of H.R. 1429.

action.text: Mr. Kildee asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: Makes corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 1429 (Improving Head Start for School Readiness Act of 2007) to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue regulations that require Head Start agencies to implement policies and procedures to ensure that homeless children are identified and prioritized for enrollment.
